para: Media server should be able to establish several connections between the endpoint and the packet networks, or between the endpoint and other endpoints in the same gateway. The signals originating from these connections shall be mixed according to the connection "mode", as specified later in this document. The precise number of connections that an endpoint support is a characteristic of the gateway, and may in fact vary according with the allocation of resource within the gateway.
The configurable attributes of the announcment player are as follows:

listitem.para: JndiName - The JNDI name under which endpoint is to be bound.
BindAddress - The IP address to which this endpoint will be bound.
Jitter - The size of jitter buffer in milliseconds.
PacketizationPeriod - the period of media stream packetization in milliseconds.
PCMA - enable or disable G711 (A-law) codec support.
PCMU - enable or disable G711 (U-law) codec support.

para: Endpoint is able to receive the follwing RTP media types:
The DTMF configuration is determinted by DTMF attribute. The properties are as follows:

listitem.para: detector.mode. Configures DTMF detector mode. Possible values are AUTO, INBAND and RFC2833.
dtmf.payload. Configures the payload number if RFC2833 mode is specified
